summary: The diff does not provide evidence that the backend default admin password was reset to Admin@123 or that the frontend UI copy and documentation were updated accordingly. It also appears to introduce/describe changes related to shifting admin auth away from Internet Identity and other admin-login UX behavior that were not requested.

missing_requirements.requirement: Reset the default admin credentials so that username remains `admin` and password is set to `Admin@123`, and the admin username/password login flow accepts these credentials immediately after deployment (including failing incorrect passwords with an error containing "Invalid username or password").
missing_requirements.reason: No evidence in the provided `backend/main.mo` diff snippet that a default admin password is set/updated to `Admin@123` or that the backend `adminLogin` implementation enforces/accepts these credentials. The frontend even contains a comment indicating the backend method will be added.

missing_requirements.requirement: Update the admin login UI copy on `/admin/login` so helper text under "Default admin username: admin" indicates the current password is `Admin@123` (English), without changing username text, and keep validations/error messaging functional.
missing_requirements.reason: The shown portion of `AdminLoginPage.tsx` does not include the required helper text mentioning the default password `Admin@123`. The diff is truncated and does not demonstrate that this specific copy exists elsewhere in the file.

missing_requirements.requirement: Update `frontend/README.md` to state the admin login URL `/admin/login` and default credentials (admin / Admin@123) in English.
missing_requirements.reason: `frontend/README.md` is not shown as modified in the diff summary, and no documentation change evidence is provided.

hallucinated_features.description: Admin login page auto-redirect behavior based on an existing token and logic to avoid redirect loops.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by the BuildRequest (which only asks to update UI copy about the reset password and keep existing validations/error messaging functional).

hallucinated_features.description: Frontend error message indicating "Admin login is not yet configured on the backend" when errors include 'adminLogin'.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested; the request expects admin login to work with the reset credentials immediately after deployment, not to add messaging about missing backend configuration.

hallucinated_features.description: Project state/documentation change indicating a shift of admin authentication away from Internet Identity to username/password for admin access.
hallucinated_features.reason: This conflicts with the stated non-goal: "Do not change customer authentication (Internet Identity) behavior." The BuildRequest only asks to reset the default admin password and update UI copy/docs accordingly.
